<b>Topics</b>: Decision-theoretic notation. Bayes estimator. Parametric families. Example: A/B testing.
Intrinsic loss functions. Examples of derivation of Bayes estimators. Doob's consistency theorem.
Rapid model development with probabilistic programming (i.e. languages such as BUGS, JAGS, Stan, etc). Example: challenger data.
Hierarchies and mixtures. Examples: launchers data, geyser data.
Model selection and averaging. Example: rabbit holes.
Nested sampling, IS, SIS. Example: HMMs.
SMC, SMC samplers. Some theoretical properties. Example:tree inference.
Particle MCMC. Proof of correctness. Particle genealogies.
Reversible jump MCMC. Example: multiplicative proposals.
Reversible jump MCMC vs. Bayesian non-parametric methods.
Sampling in non-conjugate BNP models, hierarchical models and the sequence memoizer. Example: language modelling.
Second lab: 5pm, computer room on main floor of ESB
